intro: Scorzonera hondae, commonly known as the Honduran scorzonera, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces showy yellow to orange flowers that bloom in the spring and summer months. Scorzonera hondae typically grows in rocky or well-drained soils and is adapted to temperate climates. Its root system is fibrous, and it is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its attractive appearance.
